meanings.definition: A track or set of tracks made of steel rails along which passenger and freight trains run.
meanings.sent1: The old steam engine chugged along the railroads, carrying goods to the city.
meanings.sent2: The passengers enjoyed the scenic views as the train traveled on the railroads.
meanings.sent3: Why did the train refuse to run on the railroads? Because it had too many tracks to choose from!
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a series of interconnected railroads, each leading to a different destination.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the train whistle echoed through the quiet night, signaling its approach on the railroads.

meanings.definition: To transport or convey by railroad.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to railroad the goods to the warehouse for faster delivery.
meanings.sent2: They planned to railroad the supplies to the remote village using the train.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to railroad the acorns on the toy train around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her friends joked that she could railroad anyone into joining her adventurous expeditions.
meanings.sent5: The determined team managed to railroad the heavy equipment onto the train before it departed.

meanings.sent1: He dreamed of railroading across the country, fixing tracks and helping trains run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the challenges of railroading and learning about the different train systems.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown attempted to railroad on the toy train but ended up causing chaos instead.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork was like a well-oiled machine, smoothly railroading through the maintenance tasks.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated engineer spent years railroading, ensuring the safety of the passengers and cargo.
